intro: Fridericia pliciflora, commonly known as the folded-leaved fridericia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate, pinnately lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in wetlands. Fridericia pliciflora is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to wet, humid environments.
